author: David Clarkson
comment: I just installed it to comment on this. I saw where the dev responded to someone's one star rating asking them to review the app again. Here is my middle finger. --NO! We will not review this again if we thought it was pointless! Please go reevaluate your app, you amoeba.

author: Brent Rains
comment: Useless app, here is why: all of the apps on it aren't even all for Android wear. It's easier to search on google play, which is where everyone found this app. Logic would dictate that this app is useless. There isn't anything on there that is exclusive or even new, just a poor attempt at a "store"  in my opinion.

reply.author: Wearable Software
reply.content: Why is this app useless? Please review again. Thank you.

title: Pointless

author: CBS FitLife
comment: These apps attached to this program is broken.  It doesn't know what it wants to do. I am highly considering returning to Samsung's  Tizen. I feel like I've  wasted my money. I really wanted to believe in android wear.

reply.author: Wearable Software
reply.content: Why do you give a bad review? Your problem with Android Wear is not a problem of this app. Please review again. Thanks.

title: Unstable product

author: Great Value Pop Tarts
comment: Do you honestly think that telling someone to review your app again is smart. Wrong, it makes you look desperate for a good rating. Maybe you could listen to your audience instead of sitting on your ass trying to make the best of a bad situation. Lets not forget that these apps arent even exclusive to android wear so they are barely compatible. This app needs serious work.

author: Gergo Viczian
comment: Good collection of apps, though lists are a little stuttery on my Note 3. I know it's not the newest of devices, but other apps still perform much smoother.    I think it would be useful to have a section devoted to launcher apps, with of course Wear Mini Launcher and Bubble Cloud Launcher on the top but there are a lot of other choices too. I think these -- like launchers on the phone -- will stay to be relevant even if the platform now offers a barebones functionality in AWv5.1.1.

author: Andrew Salvhus
comment: Working well so far. Was easier to find apps for Samsung S2 Neo but I really like android wear better. Just more difficult to find apps but after figuring things out has so much more power in Wear.
title: Current samsung wear live

author: Mike Smith
comment: Annoying to go through all the watch faces to find apps.  Would be better if you could better see what the app will look like on the watch.  If the printing gets any smaller I'm going to need a magnifying glass.  Search function would be useful. Not a lot of useful apps when you compare what the iwatch has access to and far too many, especially the watch faces, charge a fee.
title: Ok but needs work

author: Brian Sobetski
comment: First of all great app, it let's me see all of the android wear apps easily. But its ugly looking honestly 1990's stuff, make it look nice more like Google play store. Also why don't you show pictures of the apps. Its a 6 out of 5 stars app but you just need easy updates to fix it.
title: Good but could be better

author: TRICIA LUGO
comment: I wish you would put a "My App List" so you don't have to go through all the apps just to find the one's you downloaded. & not all the apps show up on my smart watch. Is there a limit you can put on my watch?

reply.author: Wearable Software
reply.content: To see all your installed apps. Your use the integrated app manager. Please review again. Thank you.

title: GREAT BUT!

author: Michael Schafer
comment: Please don't nag your users for ratings.   You might find you get better ratings if you don't tick off users.
title: Nagging pop-ups are annoying

author: BrandonF
comment: Not a very attractive UI first off. Second, some of the "suggested wear apps" aren't even compatible with Android Wear. If they are compatible it must be in some oddball capacity that's not worth the effort. Netflix would be a good example of what I'm referring. No third reason, I couldn't get past the first two.
title: Not so great

author: Neil Hunt
comment: I will adjust stars after I get a chance to use it. Really bugging me for a review while simply trying to try app each screen isn't a good idea
title: OK I haven't tried yet wants review wait

author: Karl Pearson
comment: I'm not real impressed with this software. It isn't as intuitive or powerful as I it could be. I think that's because it's not been given as much control over the phone as I'd like to think it could have. Perhaps the phone's hardware is too limited in its capability.

author: The Degu Rangers
comment: What good is an app store that not only does not show you all the apps available but one that highlights free apps and watch faces that when you click on them it tries to charge you for?  Well if you want to find out install this app. The amount of free content on here that you actually need to pay for is unbelievable. Out of the top 20 free apps listed, 15 had a price tag when opened in the playstore. Wrong prices throughout I can only call it incompetence at best or criminal fraud at worse
title: Deceitful and lies

author: Sean McShane
comment: It shows every andriod wear app. The only thing I'd like to say is that sometimes it says it's a free app then you click.on it and you have to pay.
title: Brilliant

author: Adriaño Fortè
comment: Have to pay military ranger its free very bad not free at all uninstall it
title: Describe item free

author: Theodore Pack
comment: Total time saver for smart watch owners. Easily find apps and watch faces you want ( need). I use this app several times a day whenever I want something new.
title: Must Have

author: Lucky Repo
comment: Hard to find actual watchfaces. Mucked up with apps that have no relation to android wear. Edit: Dev told me to click watch faces to get watch faces. Shows a bunch of apps that have no relation to android wear. My original statement still stands.

reply.author: Wearable Software
reply.content: Click on watchfaces and you have a list of watchfaces. Please review again. Thank you.

title: Not really great

author: zane prescott
comment: A small suggestion though. Maybe put the apps into categories based on what device they are best suited for like moto 360 the LG g watch and so on and so forth. Outside of that you guys have created a fantastic app  keep up the great work
title: Great

author: Xavier Donavyn
comment: Such a great concept to have all the available wear apps in one section, a tiny bit of a nuisance that it just redirects back to the play store but at the moment it's the best/only option we have. Basically great because it's the first.
title: Great app

author: Ashley Strachan
comment: Handy tool for keeping track of everything wear compatible. Layout can be a bit cramped, would prefer larger install button and maybe more screenshots. But does the job and does it well.

author: shaunlee sherrod
comment: It's not the best. But it's good enough. Just rating so it shuts up
title: It's alright

author: Crash Override
comment: If it didn't nag you constantly to rate it I would rate it higher but every button press brings up the 'rate me' window.
title: Decent app

author: Jason Witt
comment: Asking me six times in less than a minute to review your app is a bit ridiculous. Otherwise, this app is actually pretty good.

reply.author: Wearable Software
reply.content: You have to check "don't ask me again" on the dialog. Please review again. Thank you.

title: Calm down

author: Bill Burridge
comment: Useful to screen out non wear apps as so many apps have similar names. Would prefer the ratings to be shown with decimal point like the main play store, for better granularity
title: Time saving

author: Andrew Blessinger
comment: Would be nice to be able to get to reviews, and additional images/screenshots. Orherwise, the app performs as it should
title: Not very user friendly

author: Tigerstown
comment: Please don't nag to rate your app. If your app is good which it is!! People will rate you trust me  Its so annoying.

author: Barry Robinson
comment: I wish that it didn't drop back out into standard apps. That's my only complaint...
title: Good software

author: Greg Matlock
comment: If you have LG, G Watch this is a must have app**I can't begin to tell you how much i use this app to dress up my LG gwatch....*
title: A Must Have App..

author: mike lawlor
comment: I like the idea of this app but it needs improvement. We need to see screenshots of what each app looks like on a wear device. Also, when you search and it doesn't come up with anything, there is no message, just a blank white screen.
title: I like it but...

author: Tyler Kino
comment: I'm new to it so I haven't found any bad things yet
title: It's good

author: chris kern
comment: Hate how it nags you to rate it Everytime u click something
title: Liked almost everything

author: Jeff Kelly
comment: I go to new releases.... The same stuff had been listed for weeks. And there are 'new' stuff in there from August.... I'm a bit confused. Is that a new release?
title: Um what?

author: Nate Bauder
comment: You're thinking to yourself, "this is just a shortcut to apps in the play store". But that's a good thing! It's very helpful to only see what Wear apps you have installed and only Wear apps.
title: Excellent!

author: Jayson Stancill
comment: All you need apps wise would give it 5* but there are a few bugs.
title: Great app!!

author: Christopher Clement
comment: This is a good app but the prices tend to be incorrect. They are more then what they cost on the play store
title: Great app, although prices are wrong

author: Rob Weavers
comment: Browsing through hundreds of apps on the play store is a bore. All android wear apps listed in one place.
title: Great app, just what my smartwatch needed

author: Bhupesh Shah
comment: Please include the ability to filter or select categories. It's not fun scrolling through all the wonderful watch faces.
title: Suggestion

author: Ken Alden
comment: Kind of necessary evil for my moto 360, but it's consuming half my battery on my moto x.

reply.author: Wearable Software
reply.content: Why do you think this app causes a battery drain? That's not possible. Maybe another app produces the battery drain. Review again. Thanks.

title: Drains my battery

author: Dmitri Petras
comment: All "new" apps were new in November '15. No updates since then. Just a static catalogue. Avoid this app.
title: Old news
